positions.subtitle: Business Club, IIT Kharagpur
positions.description: B-Club, IIT Kharagpur, is a non-profit organization aiming to familiarize its members, with the technicalities of analytics, finance, and consultancy. We strive to enhance our knowledge through in-house workshops, presentations, debates and group discussions. Matters deliberated vary from practical problems to hypothetical ones. The club serves as an excellent interface among students, professionals, faculty, and alumni and develops the members into creative thinkers and strategists much before they step into the big world of business.

experience.title: Summer Research Intern
experience.description: During my two-month internship at Indian Institute Of Management, Udaipur , I helped my team in providing financial insights investment space. I analyzed investment opportunities for investors over a long duration, and critically studied about Robo-advising and it's impact on the industry. I also developed a model for the bias detection being passed to clients from investment managers along with the need of a thorough diversification strategy. The robo-advising model after analyzing the investment space helped to reduce behavioral bias (disposition effect) by a meaningful 30%. Analyzed the effect of modelâ€™s adoption thereby increasing the user login by 10% and helped 38% users (holding =< 3 shares) to diversify their portfolio Published an article dictating the future of Robo-advising and improving the financial literacy of individuals in the Centre for Digital Enterprise
experience.description_html: During my two-month internship at Indian Institute Of Management, Udaipur , I helped my team in providing financial insights investment space. I analyzed investment opportunities for investors over a long duration, and critically studied about Robo-advising and it's impact on the industry. I also developed a model for the bias detection being passed to clients from investment managers along with the need of a thorough diversification strategy. The robo-advising model after analyzing the investment space helped to reduce behavioral bias (disposition effect) by a meaningful 30%. Analyzed the effect of modelâ€™s adoption thereby increasing the user login by 10% and helped 38% users (holding =< 3 shares) to diversify their portfolio Published an article dictating the future of Robo-advising and improving the financial literacy of individuals in the Centre for Digital Enterprise
